intro: Galium cruciata var. varians, commonly known as the variable bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing herbaceous species characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are often hairy and have a distinctive scent when crushed.
